data.title: School of Health and Rehabilitation Sciences Online
data.meta_description: Transform your future with the School of Health and Rehabilitation Sciences Online at the University of Pittsburgh. Discover excellence in online education.
data.meta_site_name: School of Health and Rehabilitation Sciences
data.text:
Health Informatics

An online Master of Science in Health Informatics (MSHI) gives you the tools and knowledge you need to take your career to the next level—and create impact in your community and beyond. With Pitt’s MSHI program, you’ll learn to analyze health care data in order to predict and make important decisions, as well as communicate this data to others. Whether you attend full- or part-time, our online courses are designed to fit your busy lifestyle. Say HI to making a real difference in health care.

Online Learning

Being a student at Pitt means being part of a community bigger than yourself—regardless of whether you’re learning on campus or online. Pitt online programs are designed to provide the same quality and rigor as our historically high-ranked on campus programs. We offer relevant courses, renowned faculty and individualized support to each student.

Our programs incorporate several interactive components to foster a dynamic, engaging and personalized learning experience. As an online student, you’ll benefit from discussions during live, face-to-face classes and self-paced coursework that allow you to earn your degree from wherever you live, without sacrificing your career.

Due to the online modality, you have the unique opportunity to build strong networks with a diverse group of professionals living and working all over the country and the world, who bring their varied perspectives and experiences to the classroom. The learning experience is designed to ensure that each student feels a sense of community and belonging to Pitt, empowering you to meet your professional goals in a supportive environment.

About Pitt SHRS

Established in 1969 as a health sciences school of the University of Pittsburgh, the School of Health and Rehabilitation Sciences stands on its solid reputation as an international leader in rehabilitation and disabilities education, research, and community service, improving the lives and independence of all people with a focus on those at risk for or having chronic conditions or disabilities and those who have traditionally been underserved and underrepresented.

We seek to be a catalyst for a world free of barriers and disparities that allows all people, regardless of health, to have opportunities to participate in life to the fullest; to be accomplished through education, research and service.

A beacon of academic, clinical, and research excellence in the region, Pitt SHRS draws upon its strong network of prominent health systems in the Pittsburgh area and beyond to provide access to industry experts and innovators, research and career opportunities, and ultimately a top-tier education to its students.
